intro: Phylica buxifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf phylica, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage that resembles boxwood. The plant produces small, white, spherical flowers that are clustered in dense, rounded inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
